properties.Name: ExperianCompanyBalanceSheet
properties.Description: Balance Sheet information provided by Standard and Poor.

Columns.Name: ExperianFileNumber
Columns.Description: The unique and persistent number that identifies and tracks the Experian company.

Columns.Name: ProfileTimestamp
Columns.Description: The timestamp of the Experian profile.

Columns.Name: FiscalYear
Columns.Description: The fiscal year of the data reported.

Columns.Name: EndingDate
Columns.Description: The ending date of the fiscal year.

Columns.Name: CashAndEquivalentAmount
Columns.Description: The term cash and cash equivalents includes: currency, coins, checks received but not yet deposited, checking accounts, petty cash, savings accounts, money market accounts, and short-term, highly liquid investments with a maturity of three months or less at the time of purchase such as U.S. treasury bills and commercial paper.

Columns.Name: NetReceivablesAmount
Columns.Description: Accounts receivable is the money that a company has a right to receive because it had provided customers with goods and/or services

Columns.Name: InventoryAmount
Columns.Description: Inventory is a company's goods on hand, which is often a significant current asset. Inventory serves as a buffer between a company's sales of goods and its production or purchase of goods

Columns.Name: OtherCurrentAssetsAmount
Columns.Description: A firm's assets that do not include cash, securities, receivables, inventory and prepaid assets, and can be convertible into cash within one business cycle, which is usually one year

Columns.Name: TotalCurrentAssetsAmount
Columns.Description: Current assets include cash and cash equivalents, accounts receivable, inventory, marketable securities, prepaid expenses and other liquid assets that can be readily converted to cash.

Columns.Name: NetFixedAssetsAmount
Columns.Description: Fixed assets are usually reported on the balance sheet as property, plant and equipment.

Columns.Name: InvestmentAmount
Columns.Description: The long term asset category of a classified balance sheet which appears immediately after the current assets. Listed in this category would be a bond sinking fund, funds held for construction, the cash surrender value of a life insurance policy owned by the company, and long term investments in stocks and bonds.

Columns.Name: OtherAssetsAmount
Columns.Description: A firm's assets that do not include cash, securities, receivables, inventory and prepaid assets, and can be convertible into cash within one business cycle, which is usually one year.

Columns.Name: TotalAssetsAmount
Columns.Description:
Total assets refers to the total amount of assets owned by an entity. 

- Cash
- Marketable securities
- Accounts receivable
- Prepaid expenses
- Inventory
- Fixed assets
- Intangible assets
- Goodwill
- Other assets

Columns.Name: DebtDueIn1YearAmount
Columns.Description: The amount of debt due in 1 year.

Columns.Name: NotesPayableAmount
Columns.Description: Notes Payable is a general ledger account in which a company records the face amounts of the promissory notes that it has issued

Columns.Name: AccountsPayableAmount
Columns.Description: Account payable is a liability to a creditor, carried on open account, usually for purchases of goods and services

Columns.Name: TaxesPayableAmount
Columns.Description: Income tax payable is a type of account in the current liabilities section of a company's balance sheet comprised of taxes that must be paid to the government within one year.

Columns.Name: OtherCurrentLiabilitiesAmount
Columns.Description: Other current liabilities is a balance sheet entry used by companies to group together current liabilities that are not assigned to common liabilities such as debt obligations or accounts payable.

Columns.Name: TotalCurrentLiabilitiesAmount
Columns.Description: Current liabilities are a company's debts or obligations that are due within one year, appearing on the company's balance sheet and include short term debt, accounts payable, accrued liabilities and other debts.

Columns.Name: LongTermDebtAmount
Columns.Description: Long-term debt generally refers to a company's loans and other liabilities that will not become due within one year of the balance sheet date.

Columns.Name: OtherLiabilitiesAmount
Columns.Description: Other Long-Term Liabilities' A balance sheet item that includes obligations which are not going to be paid off within the year or operating cycle, but are not included in the "long term liabilities" category.

Columns.Name: NetWorthAmount
Columns.Description: Net worth is any asset owned minus any debt owed.

Columns.Name: TotalLiabilitiesAndNetWorthAmount
Columns.Description: The total liabilities and net worth combined amount.
